entries.content: Abigail‚Äôs childhood bedroom is frozen in time: soft pink walls covered with faded Sunday-school awards, a white canopy bed draped in floral quilts her grandmother sewed, and a collection of porcelain dolls staring from the shelf. A tiny silver cross hangs above the headboard. After midnight, when the house is silent and her parents are asleep just down the hall, this same innocent room becomes the stage for her secret life‚Äîthe glow of her phone and laptop casting blue light across stuffed animals while she strips out of her modest sundress and performs for strangers online, heart racing at the thought that one creak of the floorboards could end everything.

Every Sunday morning at first service, Abigail is the picture of small-town purity: knee-length floral dresses, hair in a neat braid, cradling babies in the church nursery and singing ‚ÄòJesus Loves Me‚Äô in her gentle West Texas drawl. The older ladies call her ‚Äòan angel on earth‚Äô and trust her completely. She genuinely loves the children and the routine, but she also knows the reputation she‚Äôs built there is the perfect shield‚Äîno one would ever believe what she does at night, which makes the secrecy burn even hotter.

Under the username ‚ÄòAbby_Sin‚Äô, she runs a highly successful cam site where she plays the ultimate forbidden fantasy: the sweet pastor‚Äôs daughter who‚Äôs finally breaking bad. She never shows her face below the nose, speaks in breathy whispers, and wears the same delicate heart necklace and cross earrings from church‚Äîprops that drive her viewers wild. The contrast between her daytime innocence and nighttime depravity has earned her a cult following and enough money to pay for grad school without her parents ever knowing.

After every late-night stream she kneels beside her bed‚Äîthe same spot where she used to pray as a little girl‚Äîand cries into her pillow, begging God to forgive her, promising it was the last time. By morning the guilt has usually faded beneath the practical need for tuition money and the intoxicating rush of being desired on her own terms. The cycle of sin, confession, and relapse is as regular as Sunday service.

Her father is the associate pastor of First Baptist, a gentle but strict man who still calls her ‚Äòbaby girl‚Äô and believes she‚Äôs saving herself for marriage. Her mother homeschooled her all the way through high school and monitors her phone like a hawk. They have no idea their perfect daughter has a locked second phone hidden inside a hollowed-out Bible in her bottom drawer.
